Imports

bson, wire, auth

Types

Connection = object
  socket*: AsyncSocket         ## Socket which used for sending/receiving Bson.
  id*: int                     ## Identifier which used in pool for socket availability.
Connection is an object representation of a single asyncsocket and its identifier.   Source Edit 
Pool = ref object
  connections: TableRef[int, Connection] ## Actual pool for keeping connections.
  available*: Deque[int]       ## The deque mechanism to indicate which\
                       ## connection available.
A single ref object that will live as long Mongo ref-object lives.   Source Edit

proc initPool(size = 16): Pool {...}{.raises: [OSError, Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Init a pool. The size very likely higher than supplied pool size, because of deque need to be in size the power of 2.   Source Edit 
proc getConn(p: Pool): Future[(int, Connection)] {...}{.
    raises: [Exception, ValueError, FutureError], tags: [RootEffect, TimeEffect].}
Retrieve a random connection with its id in async. In case no available queues in the pool, it will poll whether any other connections will be available soon.   Source Edit 
proc connect(p: Pool; address: string; port: int): owned(Future[void]) {...}{.
    raises: [Exception, FutureError], tags: [RootEffect].}
Connect all connection to specified address and port.   Source Edit 
proc close(p: Pool) {...}{.raises: [Exception, SslError, OSError], tags: [RootEffect].}
Close all connections in a pool.   Source Edit 
proc endConn(p: Pool; i: Positive) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
End a connection and return back the id to available queues.   Source Edit 
proc authenticate(p: Pool; user, pass: string; T: typedesc = Sha256Digest;
                 dbname = "admin.$cmd"): Future[bool]
Authenticate all connections in a pool with supplied username, password, type which default to SHA256Digest, and database which default to "admin". Type receives SHA1Digest as other typedesc.   Source Edit
